poem:
Title: "In Distant Lands, A Pulsing Rhythm"

Pausing between tea and morning light,
A bold banner of a distant fight.
Echoes of Mandela, a sacrifice remembered,
Election's dice cast, fate now rendered. 
Nightfall dances with whispers of change,
Yet shadows of disparity still blank the range.
Eve of the vote, under an African sky,
A nation's pulse flutters, hopeful and high.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Africa elections: voting under way amid grim national mood South Africans are voting in what are expected to be the most competitive elections since the end of apartheid, which could result in the ruling African National Congress (ANC) party losing its majority for the first time since Nelson Mandela led it to power 30 years ago. The national mood is grim owing to some of the world’s highest rates of unemployment and inequality, power". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
